Matt, I don't have a lot of experience in stock trading problems, but
one c=
andidate for geometric interpretation is time. 
Chronological/temporal info=
rmation could be arranged along one axis of
the substrate.  Of course, ther=
e are other ways to integrate
information over time (like recurrence) but s=
till, HyperNEAT might be
able to do something interesting with an axis like=
 that.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Matt Simmerson" <m.simmerson@...=
> wrote:
>
> Hi Jeff
> 
> What do you feed into the CPNN if not geometric i=
nformation?  The CPNN
> is used to exploit the geometric information in Hyp=
erNeat, but if this
> is not relevant to a domain, such as stock trading, h=
ow do you get it
> to encode the substrate in a meaningful way? 
> 
> Be gr=
eat to further this discussion.
> 
> Cheers
> 
> Matt
>

ogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jclune@> wrote:

ect encoding, and thus is more likely to create

at exhibit repetitions and symmetry (with and without

m NEAT

es--Buy/Sell

good

-1 analog
output
> > >> be best (meaning buy when buy is > sell by 0.2 or s=
omething)?  How

nyway?

or down) over
